abstract_summ: A key implication is that there is a large pool of susceptible residents if community COVID-19 incidence increases again.Abstract Objectives Many nursing home residents infected with SARS-CoV-2 fail to be identified with standard screening for the associated COVID-19 syndrome.The average maximum temperature in SARS-CoV-2 positive residents was 37.66 (0.69) compared to 37.11 (0.36) (p=0.001) in SARS-CoV-2 negative residents.We compared implementation of the guidance between the LTCFs with at least one case of COVID-19 among residents and/or health care professionals and LTCFs without COVID-19 case (between March 23rd and May 6th).On April 13, 2020, two patients were transferred to Wyoming's state psychiatric hospital from a private psychiatric hospital that had confirmed COVID-19 cases among its residents and staff members (5).

title_abstract_phrases: Temperature in Nursing Home Residents Systematically Tested for SARS-CoV-2Abstract Objectives Many nursing home residents infected with SARS-CoV-2 fail to be identified with standard screening for the associated COVID-19 syndrome.In response, the state hospital implemented expanded COVID-19 infection prevention and control (IPC) procedures (e.g., enhanced screening, testing, and management of new patient admissions) and adapted some standard IPC measures to facilitate implementation within the psychiatric patient population (e.g., use of modified face coverings).This was repeated weekly in all previously negative subjects until the testing identified no new cases and in all positive subjects until the testing was negative.The average maximum temperature in SARS-CoV-2 positive residents was 37.66 (0.69) compared to 37.11 (0.36) (p=0.001) in SARS-CoV-2 negative residents.A key implication is that there is a large pool of susceptible residents if community COVID-19 incidence increases again.
